content: Investments P2P Lending Asked by AnonymousAsked on 05 May 2019Do i have to declare taxs for earnings from crowd funding platform such as seedin? If no, is there a cap for earnings before i have to declare them in my tax form?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 11 May 2019I can't post the link but they use the term invest loosely.
U actually lend to sme so your returns are interest income and u have to report it.
In singapore just report it and if your total assessable income is less than 20k then no tax is paid.0 comments0
